defs.docs: A procedural noise generation library for Rust.

attributes.value: / A procedural noise generation library for Rust.

defs.name: Point2
defs.docs:
A 2-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible
 with most linear algebra libraries.

attributes.value: / A 2-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible

defs.name: Point3
defs.docs:
A 3-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible
 with most linear algebra libraries.

attributes.value: / A 3-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible

defs.name: Point4
defs.docs:
A 4-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible
 with most linear algebra libraries.

attributes.value: / A 4-dimensional point. This is a fixed sized array, so should be compatible

defs.name: Seed
defs.docs: A seed table, required by all noise functions.

attributes.value: / A seed table, required by all noise functions.
/ Table creation is expensive, so in most circumstances you'll only want to
/ create one of these and reuse it everywhere.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Deterministically generates a new seed table based on a `u32` value.

attributes.value: / Deterministically generates a new seed table based on a `u32` value.
/ Internally this uses a `XorShiftRng`, but we don't really need to worry
/ about cryptographic security when working with procedural noise.

defs.name: get1
defs.value: pub fn get1<T: Signed + PrimInt + NumCast>(&Self, T) -> usize

defs.name: get2
defs.value: pub fn get2<T: Signed + PrimInt + NumCast>(&Self, math::Point2<T>) -> usize

defs.name: get3
defs.value: pub fn get3<T: Signed + PrimInt + NumCast>(&Self, math::Point3<T>) -> usize

defs.name: get4
defs.value: pub fn get4<T: Signed + PrimInt + NumCast>(&Self, math::Point4<T>) -> usize

defs.name: Brownian2
defs.value: Brownian2 { function, octaves, frequency, persistence, lacunarity }
defs.docs:
A callable struct for applying 2-dimensional [fractional Brownian motion]
 (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fractional_Brownian_motion).

attributes.value: / A callable struct for applying 2-dimensional [fractional Brownian motion]
/ Fractional Brownian motion is a way of combining multiple octaves of a noise
/ function to create a richer and more varied output. It can theoretically be
/ used with any noise function, but it tends to only produce good results with
/ The struct contains many parameters, which can either be set using the
/ builder methods provided, or by constructing the type manually.

defs.name: function
defs.docs: The underlying noise function to call.

attributes.value: / The underlying noise function to call.

defs.name: octaves
defs.docs: The number of times to call the noise function.

attributes.value: / The number of times to call the noise function.

defs.name: frequency
defs.docs: The base frequency of the noise

attributes.value: / The base frequency of the noise

defs.name: persistence
defs.docs: The rate at which the amplitude of the noise is reduced for each octave.

attributes.value: / The rate at which the amplitude of the noise is reduced for each octave.

defs.name: lacunarity
defs.docs: The rate at which the frequency of the noise increases for each octave.

attributes.value: / The rate at which the frequency of the noise increases for each octave.

/ function to create a richer and more varied output. It can theoretically be
/ used with any noise function, but it tends to only produce good results with
/ The struct contains many parameters, which can either be set using the
/ builder methods provided, or by constructing the type manually.

defs.name: open_simplex2
defs.docs: 2-dimensional [OpenSimplex Noise](http://uniblock.tumblr.com/post/97868843242/noise)

attributes.value: / This is a slower but higher quality form of gradient noise than `noise::perlin2`.

defs.name: open_simplex3
defs.docs: 3-dimensional [OpenSimplex Noise](http://uniblock.tumblr.com/post/97868843242/noise)

attributes.value: / This is a slower but higher quality form of gradient noise than `noise::perlin3`.

-> (math::Point2<T>, T) where T: Float,

defs.name: GenFn2
defs.docs: A trait alias for a 2-dimensional noise function.

attributes.value: / A trait alias for a 2-dimensional noise function.
/ This is useful for succinctly parameterising over valid noise functions.
/ fn apply_noise2<F: GenFn2<f32>>(s: &Seed, p: &Point2<f32>, f: F) -> f32 { f(s, p) }

defs.name: GenFn3
defs.docs: A trait alias for a 3-dimensional noise function.

attributes.value: / A trait alias for a 3-dimensional noise function.
/ This is useful for succinctly parameterising over valid noise functions.
/ fn apply_noise3<F: GenFn3<f32>>(s: &Seed, p: &Point3<f32>, f: F) -> f32 { f(s, p) }

defs.name: GenFn4
defs.docs: A trait alias for a 4-dimensional noise function.

attributes.value: / A trait alias for a 4-dimensional noise function.
/ This is useful for succinctly parameterising over valid noise functions.
/ fn apply_noise4<F: GenFn4<f32>>(s: &Seed, p: &Point4<f32>, f: F) -> f32 { f(s, p) }
